value: A network of trust relationships among users on Advogato, an online community of open source software developers. Edge direction indicates that node i trusts node j, and edge weight denotes one of four increasing levels of declared trust from i to j: observer (0.4), apprentice (0.6), journeyer (0.8), and master (1.0).
['P. Massa, M. Salvetti, and D. Tomasoni. \Bowling alone and trust decline in social network sites.\" Dependable
column4: 2009. DASC\'09. Eighth IEEE International Conference on. (2009).

value:
category: Social
code: AD
name: Advogato
description: User–user trust
url: http://www.trustlet.org/wiki/Advogato_dataset
cite: konect:massa09
extr: advogato
long-description: This is the trust network of Advogato. Advogato is an online community platform for developers of free software launched in 1999. Nodes are users of Advogato and the directed edges represent trust relationships.  A trust link is called a \certification\" on Advogato
column3: and three different levels of certifications are possible on Advogato
column4: corresponding to three different edge weights:  certifications as apprentice (0.6)
column5: journeyer (0.8) and master (1.0). A user without any trust certificate is called an observer.  It is possible to trust oneself on Advogato
column6: and therefore the network contains loops.

value: part of the Koblenz Network Collection

# prop_name: This directory contains the TSV and related files of the advogato network: This is the trust network of Advogato. Advogato is an online community platform for developers of free software launched in 1999. Nodes are users of Advogato and the directed edges represent trust relationships.  A trust link is called a \"certification\" on Advogato
value: and three different levels of certifications are possible on Advogato
column3: corresponding to three different edge weights:  certifications as apprentice (0.6)
column4: journeyer (0.8) and master (1.0). A user without any trust certificate is called an observer.  It is possible to trust oneself on Advogato
column5: and therefore the network contains loops.

# prop_name: More information about the network is provided here:
out.advogato -- The adjacency matrix of the network in whitespace-separated values format
The meaning of the columns in out.advogato are:
First column: ID of from node
Second column: ID of to node
Third column (if present): weight or multiplicity of edge
Fourth column (if present):  timestamp of edges Unix time
ent.advogato.user.name -- Contains the attribute `name` of entity `user` of the network
